snippet: People are still being arrested illegally for possessing small amounts of marijuana in New York City. The courts need to step in and put a stop to this.
abstract: Editorial observes that New York police are still arresting large numbers of people for possession of small amounts of marijuana, despite memorandum issued by Commissioner Raymond Kelly that they should revert to a 1977 state law that bars them from doing so; contends that if lawmakers will not intervene to prevent discriminatory arrests for petty marijuana use, then the courts will have to do so instead.
lead_paragraph: People are still being arrested illegally for possessing small amounts of marijuana in New York City. The courts need to step in and put a stop to this.
